meanings.definition: People who live in the same time period as the speaker.
meanings.sent1: My ultracontemporaries in school are my classmates.
meanings.sent2: Historians study the ultracontemporaries of famous figures to understand their context.
meanings.sent3: At the reunion, I realized my ultracontemporaries have aged gracefully.
meanings.sent4: In a bustling city, the ultracontemporaries rush past each other like busy bees.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of his ultracontemporaries in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: Things that exist or occur at the same time as something else.
meanings.sent1: The invention of the telephone had many ultracontemporaries in the field of communication.
meanings.sent2: Fashion trends often have ultracontemporaries in music and art.
meanings.sent3: The cake's ultracontemporaries on the dessert table looked equally delicious.
meanings.sent4: As the storm raged on, thunder found its ultracontemporaries in flashes of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The novel's themes had ultracontemporaries in the societal issues of the time.
